abstract.p: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce reports third-quarter operating profit of 380 million Canadian dollars ($256 million), or 93 Canadian cents a share, higher than 86 cents consensus forecast by analysts (S)

block.p: Canada's second-largest bank, Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce, reported third-quarter operating profit of 380 million Canadian dollars ($256 million), or 93 Canadian cents a share, higher than the 86 cents consensus forecast by analysts surveyed by FirstCall/Thomson Financial. With after-tax gains from selling a portion of its investment in Global Crossing Ltd. and some assets, the bank's total profit was 601 million Canadian dollars ($406 million).

Canada's second-largest bank, Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce, reported third-quarter operating profit of 380 million Canadian dollars ($256 million), or 93 Canadian cents a share, higher than the 86 cents consensus forecast by analysts surveyed by FirstCall/Thomson Financial. With after-tax gains from selling a portion of its investment in Global Crossing Ltd. and some assets, the bank's total profit was 601 million Canadian dollars ($406 million).
